It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and foliage structure. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit with narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a dense cluster. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in rocky or semi-arid habitats.
